In DATE the applicants ' father 's villa and an adjacent plot of land were confiscated without compensation by the regime . The ORG subsequently built an annex to the villa .
On an unspecified date ORG informed ORG of their intention to purchase the LOC of ORG . Accordingly , they requested ORG to put at their disposal different proposals for the purchase of LOC .

On DATE the NORP ORG in GPE entered into an agreement to purchase CARDINAL buildings . CARDINAL of the buildings , designated for use as the private residence of the head of the LOC , was the villa confiscated from the applicants ' father .
On DATE the applicants informed the NORP Ambassador in GPE about their property claims to the villa , in view of the fact that it had been illegally confiscated from their father .
The transaction was concluded through an inter - State agreement authenticated by note verbale exchanges between the CARDINAL governments .
Pursuant to the relevant provisions of NORP law , as they stood at the material time , the land was inalienable ; consequently the title to the buildings alone was transferred by ORG to ORG .
The relevant property title was not entered in ORG .
On an unspecified date the applicants brought civil proceedings in ORG claiming their title to the unlawfully confiscated property .

On DATE the ORG allocated to the applicants their father 's villa and ordered ORG to make it possible for the applicants to enter into possession of that property . As ORG did not lodge an appeal , the decision became final .
Pursuant to ORG ( “ LAW ” ) , the applicants lodged an application with ORG ( PERSON i GPE dhe PERSON ) , claiming their title to their father 's property .
On DATE the Commission , confirming the unlawfulness of the confiscation of the property , allocated to them the villa and the adjacent plot of land measuring QUANTITY m.

Moreover , the court also allocated to the applicants the annex to the villa as , pursuant to LAW , the outlay by the ORG in respect of structural changes and annexes to the original building amounted to PERCENT of the property 's original value .

In so far as it was impossible for the applicants to have the whole original plot of land returned to them , the Commission held that the ORG had an obligation to pay them compensation under LAW for a plot of land measuring QUANTITY m. and it ordered the restitution of the original plot of land measuring QUANTITY m.
Lastly , the ORG ordered that the applicants ' title to the properties be entered in ORG .
The applicants were also provided with a certificate of registration of property issued by ORG , registration no . DATE , dated DATE .

In reply to the applicants ' requests for recovery of their property , on DATE the NORP Ambassador to GPE informed them that their property claims to ORG premises had to be settled with the NORP authorities .
On an unspecified date the applicants instituted proceedings against ORG in GPE , before ORG , in order to recover possession of their property .
On DATE ORG held that it did not have jurisdiction to deal with the case .
On an unspecified date the applicants brought proceedings in ORG seeking damages from ORG in GPE for its occupation of the plot of land measuring QUANTITY m.
The proceedings were adjourned several times by ORG because of the absence of the representative of ORG in GPE .

On DATE ORG , in the absence of ORG representative , ordered the ORG to pay the applicants a DATE rental fee , amounting to MONEY , for use of the plot of land measuring QUANTITY m. The decision became final and binding on DATE .
On DATE ORG , in enforcement proceedings , issued a writ for the enforcement of ORG judgment of DATE .

On DATE and CARDINAL DATE , following the failure of ORG in GPE to comply with ORG judgment of DATE and invoking the inactivity of the NORP authorities in enforcing a final decision , the applicants lodged CARDINAL appeals with ORG .
On DATE ORG dismissed the first appeal on the ground that the applicants had not exhausted all the possible means of recourse available to them in order to challenge the inactivity of ORG .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants ' second appeal , the reason being that the immunity of ORG and the inviolability of its LOC gave rise to a circumstance where ORG decision could not be enforced in practice .
On DATE , with a view to having the ORG judgment of DATE validated by the NORP courts and enforced , the applicants applied to ORG for a writ of enforcement ( delibazione ) .

On DATE , in a judgment served on the applicant on DATE , ORG rejected the applicants ' request , as the proceedings before ORG that led to the judgment of DATE had been held in breach of the principle of equality of arms , which was an essential requirement for the recognition of a foreign judgment in GPE . According to the court , by sending confused and short - term notifications of hearings , the NORP court had denied ORG in GPE the opportunity to present the case effectively and to be able to enjoy the benefit of an equality of arms .
The applicants , anticipating an unsuccessful outcome , did not appeal against ORG decision of DATE .

Following a request for factual information under LAW CARDINAL ( a ) of ORG , ORG , on DATE , having regard to the fact that the LOC of ORG in GPE had been legally purchased , contested the applicants ' allegations of possession sine titulo .
They maintained that the lawfulness of the property title to the premises of ORG in GPE stemmed from a valid international agreement between the CARDINAL countries .

Furthermore , they stated that the NORP court judgment , which had decided on ORG obligation to pay the applicants a rental fee for use of their property , had no binding effect in GPE ; in fact ORG had dismissed the applicants ' application for the validation of the above - mentioned judgment in GPE .

Following a request for factual information under LAW CARDINAL ( a ) of ORG , ORG stated on DATE that in DATE , following a request by ORG in GPE , ORG had put at its disposal CARDINAL ORG - owned LOC . ORG in GPE had arranged to purchase CARDINAL buildings , CARDINAL of which had been the former property of the applicants ' father . The agreement had been validated by note verbale on DATE .
On DATE , by note verbale no . DATE , ORG transmitted to ORG in GPE the topographic maps of the properties purchased and confirmed the legitimacy of the ownership of the properties .
According to the Government , on DATE , by decision no . CARDINAL , ORG had authorised ORG to use the income from the transaction ( a lump sum of MONEY ) for the purchase of the LOC of ORG in GPE .

“ CARDINAL . The LOC of the mission shall be inviolable . The agents of the receiving ORG may not enter them , except with the consent of the head of the mission .

CARDINAL . The receiving ORG is under a special duty to take all appropriate steps to protect the LOC of the mission against any intrusion or damage and to prevent any disturbance of the peace of the mission or impairment of its dignity .
CARDINAL . The LOC of the mission , their furnishings and other property thereon and the means of transport of the mission shall be immune from search , requisition , attachment or execution . ”

In accordance with its LAW and DATE , the Convention was opened for signature from CARDINAL DATE and will remain open for signature until DATE . Neither GPE nor GPE have signed it . In its relevant parts the LAW reads as follows :
“ A ORG enjoys immunity , in respect of itself and its property , from the jurisdiction of the courts of another ORG subject to the provisions of the present Convention . ”

“ CARDINAL . A ORG shall give effect to ORG immunity under LAW by refraining from exercising jurisdiction in a proceeding before its courts against another ORG and to that end shall ensure that its courts determine on their own initiative that the immunity of that other ORG under LAW is respected .

CARDINAL . A proceeding before a court of a ORG shall be considered to have been instituted against another ORG if that other ORG : ( a ) is named as a party to that proceeding ; or ( b ) is not named as a party to the proceeding but the proceeding in effect seeks to affect the property , rights , interests or activities of that other ORG . ”

“ Unless otherwise agreed between the GPE concerned , a ORG can not invoke immunity from jurisdiction before a court of another ORG which is otherwise competent in a proceeding which relates to the determination of : ( a ) any right or interest of the ORG in , or its possession or use of , or any obligation of the ORG arising out of its interest in , or its possession or use of , immovable property situated in the ORG of the forum ; ( b ) any right or interest of the ORG in movable or immovable property arising by way of succession , gift or bona vacantia ; or ( c ) any right or interest of the ORG in the administration of property , such as trust property , the estate of a bankrupt or the property of a company in the event of its winding up . ”

“ No post - judgment measures of constraint , such as attachment , arrest or execution , against property of a ORG may be taken in connection with a proceeding before a court of another ORG unless and except to the extent that : ( a ) the ORG has expressly consented to the taking of such measures as indicated : ( i ) by international agreement ; ( ii ) by an arbitration agreement or in a written contract ; or ( iii ) by a declaration before the court or by a written communication after a dispute between the parties has arisen ; or ( b ) the ORG has allocated or earmarked property for the satisfaction of the claim which is the object of that proceeding ; or ( c ) it has been established that the property is specifically in use or intended for use by the ORG for other than government non - commercial purposes and is in the territory of the ORG of the forum , provided that post - judgment measures of constraint may only be taken against property that has a connection with the entity against which the proceeding was directed . ”

“ In the protection of his constitutional and legal rights , freedoms and interests , and in defending a criminal charge , everyone is entitled to a fair and public hearing , within a reasonable time , by an independent and impartial court established by law . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) Any international agreement that has been ratified constitutes part of the domestic legal system after it is published in ORG . It is implemented directly , except in cases where it is not self - executing and its implementation requires enactment of a law . The amending , supplementing and repealing of laws approved by the majority of all members of the ORG , with the purpose of ratifying an international agreement , require the same majority . ( CARDINAL ) An international agreement that has been ratified prevails over national laws that are incompatible with it . ( CARDINAL ) In case of conflict , the norms issued by an international organisation prevail over the national laws if the agreement ratified by GPE for its participation in the organisation expressly contemplates their direct applicability . ”

“ The Constitutional Court shall determine : ... ( f ) Final complaints by individuals alleging a violation of their constitutional rights to a fair hearing , after all legal remedies for the protection of those rights have been exhausted . ”
“ State bodies shall comply with judicial decisions . ”

The new LAW enacted in DATE provides for CARDINAL forms of restitution of property , namely the return , under certain circumstances , of the original property and compensation in the event of impossibility for the authorities to return the original property . The LAW provides for CARDINAL forms of compensation : ( a ) property of the same kind ; ( b ) property of any other kind ; ( c ) shares in ORG - owned companies ; ( d ) the value of a ORG - owned property in the privatisation process , ( e ) a sum of money ( section CARDINAL ) .
LAW of DATE ( Law no . CARDINAL of DATE , as amended by PERSON no . DATE ) , as in force at the time , in its relevant parts reads as follows :

“ Former owners and their legal heirs have the right of ownership . A former owner of property shall have the right either to restitution of the original land or to compensation in kind if CARDINAL of CARDINAL conditions is met : ( CARDINAL ) the land formerly owned was pasture , meadow , forestry land , or agricultural or non - agricultural land ; ( CARDINAL ) the land is not subject to PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE ; ( CARDINAL ) the land is currently ORG - owned ; or ( CARDINAL ) the land has now been designated as being suitable for construction and lies within the boundaries of a town or city . The extent of restitution or compensation in kind shall not exceed QUANTITY in accordance with LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE , as amended by PERSON no . DATE . ”

“ Former owners shall be entitled to restitution of their former buildings without having to repay any outlay by the ORG or other owners for structural changes , annexes , or floor additions to former private buildings where such outlay does not exceed PERCENT of the building 's value .

Former owners shall be entitled to restitution of their former buildings once they have repaid PERCENT of the value of the outlay , where such outlay amounts to PERCENT of the building 's value . The value of the outlay shall be calculated on the basis of construction prices at the time of the building 's restitution . A building shall remain in co - ownership where the value of such outlay exceeds PERCENT of the building 's value . ... The courts shall have authority to resolve disputes between parties . ”

“ When building land or agricultural land that has become building land is occupied by a permanent structure , compensation will be provided to the former owner within the limits of expropriation in CARDINAL of the following forms : ( a ) state bonds of an equivalent value and the right of pre - emption of the holders to be exercised in the process of the privatisation of state enterprises , and in other activities funded by loans ; ( b ) an equivalent plot or building land near to land designated as an urban area in the general development plans ; ( c ) an equivalent plot of land designated as a tourist area in the general development plans .
The remaining portion for items ( b ) and ( c ) will be subject to other methods of compensation established under this PERSON . ”

Section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ( Reform of the NORP system of ORG ) provides that a foreign court 's judgment shall be recognised in GPE without formal proceedings if it complies with the following requirements :

“ ( a ) the judgment had been delivered by the competent court ; ( b ) the other party had been informed promptly of the civil claim in accordance with the domestic laws of the ORG where the proceedings had been held and the guarantee of defence rights had not been breached ; ( c ) the parties to the proceedings had been duly notified of the hearings or formally declared in absentia pursuant to the laws of the ORG in which the proceedings took place ; ( d ) the judgment had become final according to the laws of the ORG in which it had been issued ; ( e ) it did not contain provisions which ran counter to a final decision delivered by an NORP judge ; ( f ) proceedings are not in progress in GPE in respect of the same act and between the same parties ; ( g ) the judgment did not contain provisions which ran counter to the principles of the rule of law as applied by the NORP ORG ;
